turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about U.S. Route 60 in Oklahoma.
turn.1: What is the proposed extension of US-60?
turn.2: The remainder of the bypassed portion of US-60 in Missouri, east of Route 43, was to be abandoned.
turn.4: This request was approved by the Oklahoma Highway Commission on March 1, submitted to AASHO on May 5, and approved by AASHO on July 12.
turn.6: Two realignments to US-60 occurred on March 6, 1967.
turn.8: First, a portion of US-60 west of Nowata was straightened.
turn.10: Second, a segment of US-60/SH-11 east of Burbank was rerouted to the south on a straighter alignment; this new alignment also removed a concurrency with SH-18.
turn.12: On April 3, 1967, the Oklahoma Highway Commission approved a realignment of a short segment of US-60/US-64/US-81 north of Enid in Garfield and Grant Counties.
